name: Poly CV
description: This algorithm takes the polysynth control logic from other polysynths and uses it not to produce sound but to output CVs (Control Voltages) and gates. It serves primarily as a MIDI/CV converter, enabling conversion between MIDI signals and analog CV/gate outputs. Additionally, it functions as a chord/arpeggio engine controlled by either CV/gate inputs or MIDI inputs. The algorithm can also generate MIDI output alongside or instead of CV/gates, making it versatile for applications like MIDI-to-MIDI harmony generation (e.g., SATB chords). It leverages the 'Common polysynth features' section for voice allocation logic and other shared parameters.
use_cases: Arpeggiator controlled by CV/gates or MIDI
gui_description: The display shows the notes being played by various voices. When adjusting microtuning parameters, additional information about the chosen tuning is displayed.

parameters.name: MIDI channel
parameters.description: The MIDI channel to listen on.

parameters.name: MPE channels
parameters.description: Controls how the algorithm will respond to MPE (Multi-dimensional Polyphonic Expression).

parameters.name: Sustain
parameters.description: Directly controls the sustain (like a MIDI sustain pedal).

parameters.name: Min vel gate
parameters.description: Sets the minimum gate voltage, if gates are scaled by velocity. Velocity gates range from this voltage (for MIDI velocity 0) up to 5V (for MIDI velocity 127).

parameters.name: Voices
parameters.description: The number of voices to use (up to the maximum set by the specification).

parameters.name: Pitch outputs
parameters.description: Whether to include pitch CV outputs.

parameters.name: ES-5 Expander
parameters.description: If set, the ES-5 expander header to use for gate output instead of allocating a gate from regular busses. '1' means the ES-5 itself.

parameters.name: MIDI channel (output)
parameters.description: The output MIDI channel for generated MIDI signals.

parameters.name: Output to internal
parameters.description: Enables internal MIDI output â€“ that is, MIDI is sent to other algorithms.

output_ports.name: Gate
output_ports.description: Outputs gate signals for each voice. The bus assignment depends on the 'First output' and 'Voices' parameters, as well as whether velocity-scaled gates are enabled.

output_ports.name: Pitch CV
output_ports.description: Outputs pitch control voltages for each voice. Bus allocation follows the same logic as gate outputs if enabled.

output_ports.name: Velocity
output_ports.description: Outputs velocity information as a control voltage, if enabled by the 'Velocity outputs' parameter.

output_ports.name: First output
output_ports.description: The first output bus to use.

output_ports.name: ES-5 Output
output_ports.description: If using an ES-5 expander output, sets which of the 8 outputs on the expander to use.
